stimulusHtml: The West German reaction to Elvis is best explained as resulting from which of the following?

features.html:
“March 2, 1960, in Frankfurt-am-Main
 enters history as a black day
 because Elvis Presley, U.S. scream idol
 top star in the devil’s dance called rock ’n’ roll
 has left the soldiers’ ranks
 to return home to the States*
 with sadness the fans of West Germany
 will remember him
 ecstatic and in wild pain
 the young hearts cramp up
 their legs in knots
 they experience extreme farewell pain
 we feel sad about those
 who adore this young man
 because of a lack of more appropriate ideals.
 But every country is offering to its youth the very best things
 it has to offer.”
 
 *At the height of his popularity, the musician Elvis Presley was drafted by the United States Army and served in West Germany.

Poem printed in the East German foreign affairs magazine Objectiv, 1960

choicesHtml: The greater military, economic, and political involvement of the United States in Europe after the Second World War led to the spread of American popular culture.
The experience of war and genocide in the First and Second World Wars caused many Germans to reassess their nation’s role in the world.
The Nazi government condemned the influence of non-German culture on German society and sought to restrict it.
The spread of postmodernist and existentialist philosophy caused many Europeans to question traditional cultural values.
